meanings.definition: To bring about or cause something to happen.
meanings.sent1: By effectuating his plan, he made sure the party was a success.
meanings.sent2: She effectuated a positive change in her community by organizing a clean-up event.
meanings.sent3: The magician effectuated a rabbit out of his hat, surprising the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a magic wand, effectuating her dreams into reality.
meanings.sent5: The sun effectuating the growth of plants is a beautiful sight to behold.

meanings.definition: To make something a reality or put into action.
meanings.sent1: The team worked together, effectuating their project ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent2: He effectuated his dream of traveling the world by saving money for years.
meanings.sent3: The chef effectuating a delicious meal left everyone satisfied and happy.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like sparks, effectuating a chain reaction of positive change.
meanings.sent5: The artist effectuating a masterpiece captivated everyone with her talent.
